Did you know today is World Suicide Prevention Day? In fact, the month of September is designated as National Suicide Prevention Awareness Month.

When you learn to recognize the risks and signs of suicide, and how to utilize the resources available, you are better equipped to support youth who struggle with mental health.

Below are suicide prevention education and intervention resources, provided to local K12 districts from San Diego County Office of Education, County of San Diego - Government, Live Well San Diego and more. (http://bit.ly/sdcoe-prevent)

OTHER RESOURCES:
- Poway Student Support: bit.ly/PUSD-SSS
- North County Lifeline: www.nclifeline.org
- National Suicide Prevention Hotline: 1-800-273-TALK (8255)
- SAMHSA: http://bit.ly/2xpBOgs
- NAMI (National Alliance on Mental Illness): http://www.nami.org/
- The Trevor Project: http://www.thetrevorproject.org/

By consistently researching social emotional interventions that are evidence-based, and implementing those accessible resources into our programs, we create culture and conditions to support our world-class learners.

After months of caring for and raising a total of 43 animals in the Supervised Agriculture Experience (SAE) at Poway High School, 24 #PowayUnified students will finally be able to present their animals and field knowledge via the first ever virtual fair showcase June 26 & 27.

We are excited for our students to participate in the virtual showcase, and take great pride in their commitment to entrepreneurial excellence despite COVID-19 emergency closures. Students will be showing their animals by video conference for the San Diego County Fair and Ramona County Fair.

PHS has over 200 students enrolled in Career in Technical Education (CTE) Agriculture classes. Each trimester, they spend 10 hours immersed in the industry outside of the classroom, such as with a veterinarian, animal therapy program or horticulturists. They also complete hands on projects in their desired industry to further their education.

If you or anyone you know would be interested in supporting these youth in their agricultural education, please reach out to Poway FFA on Facebook or Instagram.

When they were called on during the pandemic to serve, they did - armed with masks and desire to help.

To all #PowayUnified Food and Nutrition staff: If that's not a hero, we don't know what is. THANK YOU.
